properties.areaDesc: Crawford, IL; Sullivan, IN; Clark, IL; Vigo, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 9:30PM EST until January 26 at 10:36PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

East Fork White River...Wabash River...White River...

.Minor to moderate flooding continued Friday morning in central and
southern Indiana. Crests will be/are comparable to those that
occurred in February and June of 2019.

The crest on the Wabash River is at Riverton, on the White River it
is approaching Petersburg, and on the East Fork White it is at
Shoals.  A precipitation event through Saturday afternoon will bring
either secondary crests or at least slower falls to the river levels.
Flooding along the lower portions of the White and Wabash River is
likely to continue until about the end of the month.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Wabash River at Terre Haute.
* until Sunday January 26.
* At  8:30 PM Friday the stage was 21.4 feet. This is 2.0 to 2.5 feet
higher than the observations from the old legacy gauge.
* Flood stage is 16.5 feet. This is 2.5 feet higher than flood stage
from the old legacy gauge.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will rise to near 21.8 feet by Tuesday morning then
begin falling. It will fall below flood stage Sunday January 26.
* At 22.0 feet...Pottsville Street just northwest of Terre Haute is
flooded.  Lowland flooding in progress with several river roads
flooded in Clark County Illinois.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
